page.title: 17Shanklin Beach
page.content: Most of the rubbish on the beach between Horse Ledge and Appley Steps was near the breakwater. This is because the sea washes against it and brings the rubbish with it. The kind of rubbish found was drink cartons and ice cream wrappers, probably from ships, and from people having picnics on the beach. {Fishing.}For fishing, the season and the time are not important. A good catch depends more on the tide. People fish on the end of the pier. They catch Cod, Whiting, Pout, Crabs and Weavers. The amount they catch can be a matter of luck. Some of the fish cannot be eaten, like Weavers (stinging fish) and small crabs. There is pollution in the bays and harbours.
